x10.mongo.yak
Class YakUtil

x10.lang.Object
  x10.mongo.yak.YakUtil
All Implemented Interfaces:
x10.lang.Any
public class YakUtil
extends x10.lang.Object
implements x10.io.CustomSerialization

A class of utilities for working with BSON and Mongo objects in X10. This is a place-local singleton object, to support an idiom for object construction. Here is code to create {a: 1, b: {bx: 2, by: 3}, c: 4} 

     val y = YakUtil.it(); // get the singleton
     val it = y -<"a">- 1
                -<"b">- (y -<"bx">- 2 -<"by">- 3)
                -<"c">- 3;
In code that constructs a lot of BSON or Mongo objects, consider putting this y as a static variable.

YakUtil has convenience methods for constructing queries and update modifiers. y.gt("a",3).eq("b",4) is a query object testing to see if field a is greater than 3, and field b is equal to 4. y.inc("a",1).inc("b",2) is an update modifier incrementing a by one and b by 2. You can of course build these objects directly, using the Mongo representations, but the more abstract versions may be more convenient.

Mostly used for query and update modifier constructs, which are best done with methods like gt and inc.

exists


public static YakMap exists(x10.lang.String fieldName,
                            x10.lang.Any v)




Declaration: exists(fieldName:x10.lang.String,v:x10.lang.Any): x10.mongo.yak.YakMap{self!=null}.
Construct a query asking whether the subject has a field named fieldName.
foo.exists("a", true) returns true if there is a field named "a".
foo.exists("a", false) returns true if there is not a field named "a".











Parameters:
fieldName - Name of field being compared
v - Value to return if a field named fieldName is there.
See Also:
http://api.mongodb.org/wiki/current/Advanced%20Queries.html










exists


public static YakMap exists(x10.lang.String fieldName)




Declaration: exists(fieldName:x10.lang.String): x10.mongo.yak.YakMap{self!=null}.
Construct a query asking whether a field named fieldName exists.
Equivalent to foo.exists(fieldName, true).











Parameters:
fieldName - Name of field being compared
v - Value it is being compared to.
See Also:
http://api.mongodb.org/wiki/current/Advanced%20Queries.html

mod


public static YakMap mod(x10.lang.String fieldName,
                         x10.lang.Long divisor,
                         x10.lang.Long remainder)




Declaration: mod(fieldName:x10.lang.String,divisor:x10.lang.Long,remainder:x10.lang.Long): x10.mongo.yak.YakMap{self!=null}.
Construct a query asking whether a field named fieldName has value congruent to remainder modulo divisor.
For example, foo.mod("a", 2, 0) selects values with an even "a" field.











Parameters:
fieldName - Name of field being compared
divisor - The divisor
remainder - The remainder for which the query answers true.
See Also:
http://api.mongodb.org/wiki/current/Advanced%20Queries.html

x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$$x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$this


public final YakUtil x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$$x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$this()




Declaration: x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$$x10$mongo$yak$YakUtil$this(): x10.mongo.yak.YakUtil{self==this(:x10.mongo.yak.YakUtil)}.
A class of utilities for working with BSON and Mongo objects in X10.
     This is a place-local singleton object, to support an idiom for object construction.
     Here is code to create 
     {a: 1, b: {bx: 2, by: 3}, c: 4}
     
     val y = YakUtil.it(); // get the singleton
     val it = y -<"a">- 1
                -<"b">- (y -<"bx">- 2 -<"by">- 3)
                -<"c">- 3;
     

     In code that constructs a lot of BSON or Mongo objects, consider putting this y as a static 
     variable.  
     

     YakUtil has convenience methods for constructing queries and update modifiers.
     y.gt("a",3).eq("b",4) is a query object testing to see if field a is greater than 3, and field b is equal to 4.
     y.inc("a",1).inc("b",2) is an update modifier incrementing a by one and b by 2.  
     You can of course build these objects directly, using the Mongo representations, but the more abstract versions may be more convenient.
